Name: Statue of Pa-Nefer-Nohem
Description: This statue portrays the god of childhood, Pa-Nefer-Nohem. He is seated. His right arm is resting on his chest, holding a flail, and the left hand is placed on his knee. He wears a short kilt, a large necklace, and a false beard. Despite the fact that he wears a false beard and a wig, he is represented as a child. He has the side lock of childhood coming from his curly wig. The forehead is protected by two uraei, or royal cobras, and a crown of 10 snakes is on top of the wig.
